title: Konsulter inom försvarsområde
description:
Systecon Konsult är ett ledande konsultföretag inom området Life Cycle Management som hjälper kunder att hitta design- och underhållslösningar som ger system med hög tillgänglighet till låg LCC (Livstidskostnad). Det kan handla om t ex flygplan, helikoptrar, fartyg eller markfordon. Detta görs ofta i stora projekt som antingen nyanskaffar system och materiel, eller modifierar sådant som redan är i bruk. Vi arbetar i uppdrag mot alla delar av Försvarsmakten, just nu med en tonvikt mot den marina sidan, men har även civila kunder som Kustbevakningen och Sjöfartsverket. I arbetet har vi tillgång till Systecons egenutvecklade mjukvara Opus Suite som används av hundratals företag över hela världen för att hitta den rätta balansen mellan tekniskdesign, driftprofil och underhållslösning.
 



  





 Sveriges Försvarsmakt och Totalförsvar växer och vi ser därför en kraftigt ökad efterfrågan på konsulter till flera olika spännande projekt. Den här tjänsten passar dig som tycker om att arbeta med och analysera kopplingen mellan teknik, data och affärsmål och som gärna resonerar dig fram till rätt lösningar i samråd med kollegor och kunder. Vi ser också att du som person gillar att skapa, forma och utveckla kundrelationer.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Har några års erfarenhet av teknikprojekt inom försvarssektorn.
* Har tidigare arbetat med driftsäkerhet, Integrated Logistic Support eller modellering och simulering.
* Har möjlighet att utgå från antingen Stockholm eller Karlskrona/Malmö.
* Har civil- alternativt högskoleingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.



  





 Låter det som något för dig? Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan tillsammans med ditt CV. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig. Om du har frågor angående våra lediga positioner och framtida möjligheter hos oss är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare, Anna Haglund; anna.haglund@systecongroup.com
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Kundansvarig strategiskt viktiga kunder
description:
**Nu söker vi dig som är en morgonpigg och positiv team player som brinner för växter, försäljning och långsiktiga kundrelationer.** 




  





 I denna roll kommer du ingå i vårt sälj- och inköpsteam och ansvara för flera stora nyckelkunder. Du kommer också jobba självständigt med att planera och strukturera din egen försäljning. I ansvaret ingår att hantera och utveckla kundrelationer, inköp, bokningar och planering av leveranser. Du kommer vara en viktig del i alla arbetsmoment som säkerställer att dina kunder får den bästa möjliga leveransen. Hos oss har du möjlighet att utveckla dig själv, din roll och Gustavshill medans vi tillsammans fortsätter vår resa mot att bli Sveriges bästa krukväxtgrossist.
 



  





  





 Arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Arbeta självständigt med att planera och hantera nyckelkunder
* Göra kundbesök för att underhålla och skapa nya kundrelationer
* Hantera upphandlingar
* Ansvara för egen kundlista och budget
* Köpa in och boka växter från odlare och leverantörer
* Plocka beställningar och planera leveranser
* Vara en del av butiksförsäljningen
* Skötsel av växter och tillbehör i vår butik och lager
* Arbeta i team och samverka med våra olika avdelningar



  





  





 Vem söker vi
 


* En positiv och kreativ problemlösare
* Är självdriven, strukturerad och har en god förmåga att prioritera
* Är noggrann och har erfarenhet från administrativa arbetsuppgifter
* En lagspelare som också trivs att jobba självständigt
* Grundläggande växtkunskap med god kunskap om säsongsväxter
* Gillar att skapa och upprätthålla långsiktiga kundrelationer
* Har god fysik och gillar jobba i högt tempo
* Är morgonpigg och älskar växter
* Övrigt: B-körkort och goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Arbetat med försäljning av krukväxter
* Tidigare erfarenhet som inköpare av krukväxter
* Trädgårdsmästare med erfarenhet av projektledning
* Arbetsledare eller ansvarig inom trädgårdsbranschen



  





  





 Vi erbjuder
 


* Vi erbjuder en inspirerande och kreativ arbetsmiljö
* Varierande arbetsuppgifter som stimulerar både kropp och sinne
* Kollektivavtal och friskvårdsbidrag
* Lunchförmån
* Heltid ca 40h i veckan (Visst helgarbete ingår)
* Möjligheten att påverka och utveckla din roll
* En spännande resa där vi tillsammans skapar framtidens blomstergrossist



  





 Nu har du chansen att få jobba på en attraktiv arbetsplats och kliva in i vår unika blomstervärld. Ansök idag och börja blomstra med oss.
 



  





 Läs mer på www.gustavshillblomstergrossist.com

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Sweco IT is looking for a Senior Specialist within Client Infrastructure
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Architecture and Planning, and Environmental Services
description:
**Why work with us?**
 Do you want variety in your everyday life and good conditions to grow in your role? Are you interested in operating in larger IT environments, managing thousands of devices, and deploying new features? We will strengthen our Infrastructure team at Sweco IT and are looking for someone who wants to be involved in developing future solutions within Intune and SCCM.
   

  

 You will be part of a global team and work with colleagues with specialist expertise in their field. We are a passionate team with a great deal of drive and curiosity who are happy to share our experience and knowledge in our areas of responsibility. Learning from each other and having fun at work is important to us and we act in line with our core behaviours; approachable, committed and with recognised expertise to match.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this exciting position, you will manage our existing environment and infrastructure, ensuring our services consistently meet business expectations without compromising security. You'll also engage in various projects, including migration initiatives. You will work closely with various teams within the IT department to ensure that our initiatives are effectively implemented. An important part of the role is external monitoring. This means actively and systematically following developments in technology and industry standards that affect the client's infrastructure and the user's work environment.
   

  

 We are embarking on an exciting transition from SCCM to Intune. In this role, you will have the opportunity to influence and shape our strategy to successfully achieve this objective.
   

  

 You’ll be part of the Infrastructure & Cloud unit at Sweco IT and report to the Group Manager for AD & Endpoint services. Business travel occurs as the team is currently located in four different countries. This position is based in Stockholm.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities And Tasks**
* Manage PC clients through Intune and SCCM.
* Host your existing SCCM environment.
* Manage mobile devices through Intune.
* Hardware Certification.
* Participate in migration projects.
* Create reports.
* Incident Management.


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Good knowledge in Intune
* Extensive experience and very good knowledge of operating larger Intune and SCCM environments.
* Skilled in PowerShell.
* Good knowledge within the Windows family.
* Proficiency in SQL Server Reporting Services or PowerBI.
* You feel comfortable communicating both verbally and in writing in English as this is our corporate language.


 Previous experience with Azure and related services is an advantage.
   

  

**Personal characteristics**
* Strong communication skills both verbal and in written form and ability to adjust communication depending on audience.
* You have a collaborative working style and ability to build strong relationships with various stakeholders.
* You have a curious mindset and an open-minded and enthusiastic approach.


 The landscape is constantly evolving from a technical, business and market perspective so we expect you to be a fast learner and a diligent searcher for knowledge in all these areas. You should be adaptable and willing to innovate as required. Finally, we expect you to independently shape your priorities and drive towards them.
   

  

**Why join Sweco?**
* Professional development opportunities and various training opportunities.
* A pleasant and dynamic working atmosphere in a growing and leading company.
* An industry that is going through a major shift in way of working
* A culture that values inclusion, innovation, and continuous learning
* Flexible work with freedom and responsibility and a competitive compensation package.


**Application**
 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact us. We will get back to all applicants after the recruitment process has been completed. At Sweco, we strive to be a workplace characterized by diversity. We believe that more perspectives broaden our ability to continue to achieve our goals and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of shaping the future? Then we look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Contact Us**
 If you want to know more about the position or Sweco as a workplace, please contact Mirsad Mrzljak, Team Manager AD & Endpoint services, at Mirsad.mrzljak@sweco.se.
   

  

 Background checks will be carried out on the final candidate as part of this recruitment process. We use background checks from SRI.
   

  

*Sweco plans and designs the sustainable communities and cities of the future. Together with our customers, our 22,000 architects, engineers and other experts develop solutions to manage urbanization, take advantage of the opportunities of digitalization and make the societies of the future more sustainable. Sweco is the leading consulting company in technology and architecture in Europe with a turnover of approximately SEK 29 billion. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For further information* 
 , http //www.sweco.se

title: System Center Automation Specialist
description:
**Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med PowerShell, Microsoft Windows Servers, Microsoft SQL Servers och System Center Service Manager och Orchestrator? I så fall tror vi att du skulle passa väl in hos oss på Innofactor som System Center Automation Specialist.**
**Om Rollen**
 I rollen som teknisk specialist och rådgivare hos oss kommer du att få erfarenhet av att arbeta med kunder inom olika branscher och storlekar, med lösningar anpassade efter deras behov och önskemål. Det innebär att du kommer att hantera supportärenden och förändringsarbete inom dessa teknologier, samtidigt som du utvecklar och förbättrar våra processer och rutiner. Du kommer att ha nära samarbete med både interna och externa parter och vara en viktig del av vårt leveransteam.
   

  

**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med System Center Service Manager och Orchestrator.
* God kunskap och erfarenhet av PowerShell.
* Tidigare och nuvarande erfarenhet av Microsoft Windows Servers och Microsoft SQL Servers.
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* God kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga.
* Serviceinriktad och lösningsorienterad inställning.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har Erfarenhet Av**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med andra CRM- och ärendehanteringssystem, såsom Dynamics 365 och ServiceNow.
* Certifieringar inom relevanta områden, som Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate eller Microsoft 365 Certified: Fundamentals
* Intresse för att lära dig nya teknologier och utveckla dina kunskaper.


**Be The Real You**
 Hos oss kan du vara dig själv! Här är ingen stöpt i samma form. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetares olikheter och tror att utmanande uppgifter kräver nya och olika perspektiv. Alla har olika kvaliteter, och därför tror vi inte på att skriva ner en lista på egenskaper som vi söker. Det som däremot är viktigt är att du gillar att lösa komplexa problem och sprida kunskap. För att trivas i rollen bör du ha god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga, både på svenska och engelska. För att briljera i rollen gillar du att vara konsultmässig vilket för oss innebär att du hjälper våra kunder och är ett steg före, vilket gör att du kan föreslå nya lösningar eller utmaningar som du identifierar. Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig

title: Global Account Manager (GAM) - EU
description:
**Job Description**
**Company** 
 :
   

  

 Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access, Ethernet transport services and is one of the only US providers who own and operate their own fibre infrastructure spanning the US for diverse Wave connectivity. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 235 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 The Global Account Manager is responsible for identifying and securing new business opportunities globally. By employing consultative selling techniques and relationship-building strategies, you will work directly with the nation’s leading IT Decision Makers to position Cogent's connectivity solutions. This role involves proactive outreach through direct calling, email, and onsite meetings, with a strong focus on understanding clients' current and future connectivity needs. Success in this position will be measured by meeting or exceeding monthly revenue goals and establishing Cogent as a trusted partner across commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Identify, qualify, and secure new business opportunities within a global sales territory, focusing on market segments who require IP transit, Wave connectivity, Ethernet, Colocation and IPv4 services.
* Use direct calling, email outreach, and customer meetings to connect with Key Decision Makers and generate new business opportunities.
* Employ consultative and relationship-driven sales approaches to identify prospective clients’ current and future connectivity needs.
* Position Cogent’s services as the preferred choice by leveraging our extensive global network footprint, which spans commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure customer needs are met and expectations exceeded.
* Maintain and update detailed records of sales activities in CRM systems, tracking progress, and managing customer relationships.


**Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Telesales experience in any industry, with B2B sales experience being an advantage
* Proven ability to identify, qualify, and generate new business opportunities through proactive prospecting and research.
* Strong communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to engage effectively with Key Decision Makers.
* Self-motivated, positive, and proactive, with a passion for adding value to clients and excelling in a competitive, revenue-driven environment.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, team-oriented and competitive environment with revenue-driven goals and rewards.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and basic proficiency in Microsoft Office are beneficial.
* Telecommunications experience or knowledge of connectivity solutions is advantageous but not essential.
* Cogent operates a global sales model so foreign language skills are an advantage


**Work Environment:**
 This is an in-office position, five days a week, designed to support your success through focused mentorship, training, and personal coaching.
   

  

 To apply for the Global Account Manager position, please submit your resume and cover letter to careers@cogentco.com .
   

  

 Cogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
**We are Fatshark** 




 We are a critically acclaimed Swedish game development studio with about 190 experienced and skilled employees. We are most well-known for developing the Warhammer: Vermintide franchise, but have also helped develop a number of AAA titles and we launched the highly anticipated game Warhammer 40,000: Darktide.
 



  





 We have grown quite a bit over the last few years, but we still embrace the same values that we started with. We want to build the best first person co-op games together, in an approachable, fun and passion-driven way.
 



  





**The role** 




 As a Senior Product Marketing Manager, you know the product and how to connect it with our key audiences. You identify, create, and drive global marketing plans that cater to new, and existing, customers. You possess a strong analytical acumen and business judgment and are able to apply this to drive greater results. You are able to prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a proven track record in marketing. Your passion for video games and the gaming industry is important, and you have the ability to think and act both strategically and tactically. You should also be accustomed to using customer-centric data to identify opportunities and evaluate results.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll be focused on an unannounced and original IP and responsible for a significant marketing budget, reporting directly to the Head of Marketing.
 



  





**What we offer** 



* A playful, friendly and inclusive workplace
* Opportunities for personal growth with varied projects, experienced co-workers and recurring hack weeks/days
* Regulated flex time and paid overtime
* Occupational pension
* Health benefits and health check ups
* Bonus program
* Relocation package for international talent
* Parties, social events and team-building activities
* Dog-friendly office located in central Stockholm



  





**What you'll do** 



* Lead overall product and campaign marketing strategies, tactical planning, execution, optimization, and measurement across assigned titles, both pre- and post-launch
* Partner closely with cross-functional and internal teams, including the development team, to define and drive marketing efforts
* Serve as a product marketing expert with in-depth knowledge of our games
* Create and present marketing plans to development teams and management
* Identify market trends and key opportunities for innovation
* Understand the target audience, analyze customer patterns and share insights with internal teams about what drives and motivates our players
* Continuously work on optimizing conversion activities to drive player and business KPIs
* Lead development of brand strategy, create content calendar and own style guides for assigned titles
* Validate and approve external and internal assets before deployment
* Excellent presentation skills - comfortable with presenting to key stakeholders both internally and externally



  





**Required qualifications** 



* 3-5+ years in product marketing and/or similar experience working on successful marketing campaigns
* Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment and adept at managing key internal and external partnerships
* Result-oriented, and ability to be self-sufficient with strong organizational skills
* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal
* Passionate about games, ideally with experience in games marketing
* Located in Stockholm, or willing to relocate to Stockholm



  





**Application details** 




 We have a policy of working 4 days in the office per week, with 1 day optional to work from home. The onboarding is being done fully in the office. We look forward to reviewing applications and will be interviewing candidates continuously until the position has been filled.
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm (on-site)
 



**Start:** 
 ASAP
 



**Form of Employment:** 
 permanent, full-time

title: Sales Engineer Nordics
description:
**Company Description** **Movu Robotics**  

Innovation, ambitious growth, technology, state-of-the-art robots – that’s Movu Robotics in a nutshell. Due to the in-house design and manufacturing process of our systems, an exciting, hands-on work environment with plenty of challenges and advancement opportunities is guaranteed. Will you help shape the future of intralogistics?

 **Job Description**  

The Sales Engineer Nordics is responsible to support the Nordics regional Sales team for a smooth execution of the sales activities. He/she drives the offer generation for customer tenders from a technical perspective, by translating customer needs into a value-engineered solution and offer, and by validating technical specifications with all stakeholders and costing the offered scope. He/she assists in the realization of the set targets as part of the sales organization.

* Analyzing customer needs, data and Requests for Quotation.
* Drafting automated intralogistics solutions to maximize customer value using various tools incl. AutoCAD, for all Movu Robotics solutions including iFollow, Escala, Atlas 2D, racking solutions, Warehouse Execution Software and others.
* Assessing and presenting various concepts to sales and customers.
* Estimating the full offered scope’s costs.
* Coordinating full validation of the technical design and costs with all relevant stakeholders and experts, leading to formal design and cost approval.
* Documenting the full system designs in written offers, including functional descriptions, as input to sales.
* Supporting sales in customer interactions and commercial activities.
* Managing the storage and version management of tender documents, and preparing the full project kick-off and hand-over to project execution.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Master degree in a technical field, business, supply chain management, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in an intralogistic environment is a plus.
* Affinity / interest in warehousing software is a nice-to-have.
* Strong negotiation skills and the ability to build effective relationships with customers.
* Knowledge of procurement best practices and industry trends.
* Strong project management skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent knowledge of Swedish and English. Any other language is a plus.
* Living in or around the Göteburg area.

  

**Additional Information** **What do we offer you?**

* You will work closely together with other rack stars in an open and enthusiastic environment.
* The necessary freedom and possibility to take initiative.
* An intensive training by experienced people.
* An attractive salary in an international environment, with many benefits.

 *Unsolicited representations by third parties (recruitment agencies, headhunters, ...) of CVs via mail and/or telephone for our vacancies are considered as direct applications where no compensation is provided to the third party. Any T&Cs from these third parties will not be accepted unless upon signature of the T&Cs by a person in charge of HR. Candidates remain registered in the system for 12 months and cannot be proposed again during this period.*

title: RAM Engineer
company_industry: Truck Transportation and Railroad Equipment Manufacturing
description:
At
 **Alstom** 
 , we understand transport networks and what moves people.
   

  

 From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling, and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.
   

  

 Alstom is the largest player in the Swedish railway market, with over 1,000 trains delivered and several large maintenance contracts, offering maintenance in 19 local depots. The company is also leading the ERTMS rollout in Sweden both onboard and trackside and delivering the new standard national traffic management system for Trafikverket.
   

  

 Are you ready to take your RAM expertise to the next level in a transformative and innovative industry?
   

  

**Alstom** 
 is looking for a
   

  

**RAM Engineer**
 to be based in
 **Stockholm**
**Your Future Role:**
 Working with railway signalling has never been more exiting that now. The new European standard,
 **ERTMS** 
 is on its way to reshape the future of public transportation.
   

  

 You will lead, coordinate, and perform all the
 **activities** 
 from the
 **Tender phase** 
 up to
 **Operational phase** 
 to ensure that our solutions are reliable, maintainable and available. For this, you will identify the best architecture according to
 **RAM** 
 performance requirements, customer’s needs and operational conditions. You will also guarantee a risk control for each requirement related to RAM and perform continuous reliability growth in projects and programs.
   

  

 To
 **guarantee** 
 the
 **optimal performance level of our systems** 
 , you will be accountable for the main Reliability, Availability and Maintainability aspects over the lifecycle phases of the solutions.
   

  

 You will report directly to the Nordics Regional RAM Department Head and as dotted line to the Manager of Projects and Programs to which you will be assigned and considered as the RAM reference.
   

  

 Internally, you will interface with the RAM Community, the Project or Program Core teams, Safety, the Engineering Métiers (Hardware, System, Verification & Validation, etc.), Cybersecurity, Tenders, Sourcing, Installation, Test and Commissioning, and Warranty & Maintenance. You will also be in contact with customers, suppliers, and subcontractors.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
 During Tender and Design phases, you will:
   

  

* Support Tender and Sourcing teams to choose and integrate the products and systems in the projects,
* Avoid non-compliance and minimize the penalties,
* Do Reliability Predictions (MTTF/MTBF),
* Assess Life expectation,
* Perform Failure Modes & Effects Analysis (FMEA),
* Analyse Degraded modes,
* Model Availability and calculate Service Reliability,
* Conduct Maintainability and Testability analysis.


 During Operational phase, you will lead the following activities:
   

  

* Data collection from the field or customer and data collection from the repair sites,
* Root cause identification and RAM classification of the reported failures,
* Statistical analysis of collected data,
* Reliability growth analysis and actions plans proposal,
* Design recommendations based on RAM studies,
* Verification of the adequacy of architecture choices to the RAM targets.


**About You:**
 At Alstom, we value passion, curiosity, and attitude as much as experience. Here’s what will help you thrive in this role:
   

  

* Advanced University or Engineering degree, ideally in Dependability (RAM/S),
* Scientific background in Statistics and Probabilities, together with good understanding of some System, Electrical, Electronics, Electromechanical, Telecom, Applied Mathematics or Software development techniques would be an advantage,
* Specific hands-on experience in RAM and mastering RAM methodology, concepts, methods and tools,
* Knowledgeable and experience of Railway Signalling or in other fields with high RAMS requirements (e.g., Aeronautics, Space, Defence, Automotive, Medical, Nuclear, Power, Civil Engineering, Machinery, Oil and Gas sectors),
* Structured, organized, rigorous,
* Team player and proactive behaviour,
* A flexible approach and the ability to work effectively against deadlines,
* Great problem identification and solving skills,
* Ability to drive activities performed by others (subcontractors, suppliers),
* Creativity and negotiation skills (tenders, failure reviews),
* Fully proficient English, Swedish is an added value.


**Things You’ll Enjoy**
 Join us on a transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, offering you stability, growth opportunities, and meaningful challenges.
   

  

**You’ll also:**
* Enjoy a dynamic and rewarding long-term career.
* Collaborate with supportive colleagues and transverse teams.
* Contribute to innovative and impactful projects.
* Utilize our flexible working environment.
* Benefit from our investment in your development through award-winning learning.
* Receive a fair and dynamic reward package that recognizes your performance and potential.
* You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!


**Why Alstom?**
 At Alstom, you’ll join a team committed to shaping the future of sustainable transport with innovation and purpose. Joining us means being part of a global community dedicated to excellence and creating a secure environment for our operations.
   

  

 Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?
   

  

**Important to Note**
 As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.
   

  

**Apply now**
